intro: Eriospermum linearifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Eriospermum linearifolium is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
